borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>For reasons of design and sitting, officers consider the proposed first-floor element to be unacceptable as it would appear unduly prominent and thereby harmful to the character and identity of the dwelling, terrace row and the surrounding local area of the Becontree Estate. The proposed development is therefore contrary to:&nbsp;</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies D1, D4 and D8 of the London Plan (March 2021);</p><p>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies BP2, and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);&nbsp;</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and SPP6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020</p>

<p>The proposed first floor extension, by reason of its mass, bulk and design represents poor quality development which would result in an increased sense of overbearingness, overshadowing and a loss of outlook and privacy to neighbouring properties. Therefore constituting an unneighbourly development and contrary to:</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</p><p>- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</p><p>- Policy DMD 1 and DMD 6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19)</p><p>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</p><p>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</p>
description: Construction of a part two storey part single storey rear extension and extension of front porch
